nodes.bodyText: How about sorting alphabetically instead?
That's a good idea!
You need to respect content.length().
As we had a chat, content.array() has the regulation in which the length of the returned byte[] should be equal to the content.length().
Probably an overkill to use with pooled objects?

Others two clients would be overkill, but this one has pretty much a lot of content.
Isn't it better to use alloc instead of creating byte array in this case? This is not a streaming response. so the byte buffer will be released soon. 🤔
I see. No problem then. 👍
parsing a response
Thanks!
Would it make sense to extend AbstractClientOptionsBuilder instead of exposing customizer(), like we did for ArmeriaRetrofitBuilder?
That's a good idea!
Is there any chance this could be an arbitrary string?

even AWS has multiple DCs
there are more cloud providers than AWS nowadays.

nodes.bodyText: This could be removed?

This could be removed?
deregisters
Thanks fixed. 😉
a cancellation request?
What's an instance ID? Is it possible to use the current hostname, IP address or some hashed value of them as the default instance ID?

instanceID is the unique id associated with the instance. In AWS cloud, instanceID is the instance id of the instance and in other data centers, it is the hostname of the instance.
So I guess we can just use the hostname when it's not specified. Thanks!
Sounds good. Should we move the instanceId parameter to the builder API?

Should we move the instanceId parameter to the builder API?

Yes, I'm working on it. 😄
Ditto - overkill?
Yeah. 😄
Would !...isSuccess() work here?

Have thought about it, but I guess I wanted to be as specific as I could.
Not strong on this, though. 😄
OK!
Curious if we need to renew the lease a little bit sooner than specified to avoid timing issues. Thoughts?

If a user uses default values (Eureka does not recommend to change the value), the renewal interval is 30 seconds and if Eureka does not see this heart beat in 90 seconds, the registry is removed. Also Eureka client does not have that logic. So I guess it's okay?
I see. Then it's handled by the Eureka server. No problem.
Ditto - overkill
Could replace with String.join(",", regions)?
Fixed. 😉
I'd prefer deregister as this method name so that we can make consistency with register(InstanceInfo info).

I used what they are using.
https://github.com/Netflix/eureka/wiki/Understanding-eureka-client-server-communication#cancel
https://github.com/Netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-client/src/main/java/com/netflix/discovery/shared/transport/EurekaHttpClient.java#L17
I see, then leave it as it is.
Could be static?
Oops, thanks!
Wow, TMI. 🙊
Do we need this information?  What do you think of ignoring this field from the JSON response?
The clients who are using other implementation (not EurekaEndpointGroup) might need this information.

Question: Don't we need to take multiple eureka URIs? From the HA spec of eureka, a client should attempt to connect other eureka servers if a eureka is sitting idle.
https://blog.asarkar.org/technical/netflix-eureka/#high-availability-ha
That's a good idea. How about adding a constructor that takes an EndpointGroup?
SGTM :-)
Case sensitive or insensitive?

I just followed their logic. https://github.com/Netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-client/src/main/java/com/netflix/discovery/converters/Converters.java#L497
🤔

It looks like JSON format in Eureka has a backward compatibility issue.
Netflix/eureka#1051

Yes, they have that a lot. For the overriddenstatus you gave the link, if we use the camel case the test suite fails. https://github.com/Netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-test-utils/src/main/java/com/netflix/discovery/shared/transport/SimpleEurekaHttpServer.java#L174
Missing space before @

nodes.bodyText: Should we add a variant that does not require path and make path here non-null?
I was just worried about having too much static method. 😄 Let me add the one.
How about adding some comment about priority?
Added!
Please handle the case of IPv6 address.
Oops, didn't know about it. Thanks!
Don't we need to retry to other eureka servers? Or, does it happen in EurekaWebClient?
Add RetryingClient if the user didn't specify one. 😉
